summary: The Department of Housing and Urban Development takes a "point-in-time" count to gauge how many people are experiencing homelessness on a single night. HUD relies on local communities to provide the count. During the pandemic , HUD supplemented in-person enumerations by allowing local communities to use data collected by public and nonprofit agencies on people using their services—an approach that likely improved accuracy of point-in-time...
title: Homelessness: HUD Should Help Communities Better Leverage Data to Estimate Homelessness
